page.title: 20Education in the forest
page.content: SECONDARY AND TERTIARY EDUCATION IN THE FOREST IS BEING REORGANISED. OUR LOCAL SECONDARY SCHOOL WILL BE KNOWN AS THE LAKERS. THEY START THIS AUTUMN (1985) WITH NEW STAFF AND A NEW UNIFORM BUT UNFORTUNATELY THE BUILDINGS ARE NOT COMPLETE.LAKERS IS MADE UP OF TWO SEPARATE SCHOOLS BERRYHILL SECONDARY SCHOOL AND THE ROYAL FOREST GRAMMAR SCHOOL. PART OF THE OLD GRAMMAR SCHOOL IS GOING TO BE A SIX FORM COLLEGE. THE NEW SCHOOL UNIFORM CONSISTS OF BLACK OR GREY TROUSERS OR SKIRTS, RED JUMPERS AND BLACK AND RED STRIPED TIES.ALL THE BOYS AND GIRLS FROM ELLWOOD SCHOOL WILL GO TO THE LAKERS IN FUTURE.EVENTUALLY THERE WILL BE OVER 1200 PUPILS AT THE NEW 11 TO 16 SCHOOL.
